EmailTemplate.subject: VMTurbo Top Ten Features #7: Custom Dashboards & Reports
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{Lead.First Name}},
Here's #7 of 10 VMTurbo Top Features. Of course, if at any time you want to accelerate your learning, you can visit the Green Circle Community <[[https://greencircle.vmturbo.com/welcome?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-HybridCloud&utm_content=Mid07]]> and gain tips and tricks from real VMTurbo customers and evaluators just like you. Feature #7: Custom Reports & Dashboards
Custom Reports & Dashboards give you the flexibility to serve multiple Administrative Users, Line-of-Business owners, and IT Executives by showing them the specific information they want to see, and nothing more. Custom Reports & Dashboards answer the following question:
- How can I view the health of a cluster or group? - How can I create dashboards and reports for the information I care about most?
Step-By-Step: Custom Reports & Dashboards
The following steps will guide you through Custom Dashboards & Reports:
- You can customize any dashboard using the buttons atop the Dashboards pop-out (Left-to-Right): - Scope allows you to adjust the scope of any existing dashboard elements - Reset resets the dashboard, including its scope, to default settings - + Icon (Create) launches the Custom Dashboard creation mode, discussed in Step 2, below - Edit allows you to edit the dashboard - Save allows you to save the dashboard for later, or for consumption by specific users - Delete deletes the dashboard - Direct-to-PDF saves the current dashboard as a PDF, .xlsx, or as a Report under the "Reports" tab - Custom Dashboard Creation Mode provides a simple drag-and-drop user interface with 22 pre-configured panel options: Utilization, Projected Improvements, To Do, Usage, Group Trend, Audit Log, Health, Optimize Improvements, Resize Info, Storage Info, Entity Resources, Entity Trend, Inventory, VM Operating System, VM Density, Capacity Resources, Related Entities, Query Result, Supply & Demand, Executed Actions, QoS Level, QoS Impacts*
*You can set the Scope of each drag-and-drop panel individually, OR you can add an Inventory panel, and drag-and-drop inventory elements (for example, a specific cluster) from the Inventory panel to the other drag-and-drop panels to scope to that element.
